definition: traditionally used as phonetic for ga/also pr. [ga1]/also pr. [qie2]

pinyin: Jia1 li4 lu:e4 · Jia1 li4 lei2
Jia1 li4 lu:e4 tan4 ce4 qi4

sentences.chinese: 伽利略是个重要的人物。

sentences.english: He visited Vallombrosa when he was introduced to Galileo in Fiesole.
sentences.chinese: 他被引见给尚在菲耶索的伽利略时曾经去过那里。

sentences.english: He started economics in a way that Newton and Galileo started physics.
sentences.chinese: 他开始在一地经济，牛顿和伽利略开始物理。

sentences.english: History of mechanics of materials begins with Leonardo da Vinci and Galileo Galilei.
sentences.chinese: 材料力学发端于达芬奇和伽利略。

sentences.english: It is unlikely that the recantation was sincere and he nevertheless remained under house arrest.
sentences.chinese: 伽利略的改弦易辙并不虔诚，于是在监禁中度过余生。

sentences.english: Was ist die Bedeutung des "Sehens" in Brechts Leben des Galilei ?
sentences.chinese: “看清”在布莱希特的《伽利略传》中是什么意思？

sentences.english: 1642- astronomer Galileo Galilei died in Italy.
sentences.chinese: 1642年的今天，天文学家伽利略在意大利去世。

sentences.english: Galileo and Descartes replaced that with the idea of inertia.
sentences.chinese: 伽利略和笛卡尔用惯性的概念将其取代。

sentences.english: You have on the handout the other mentions in Paradise Lost of Galileo.
sentences.chinese: 讲稿上有标出另外提到伽利略的地方。
1633年，伽利略受到宗教法庭审讯。

sentences.english: For the little spacecraft that could, there is no rest. Galileo goes on, to Ganymede.
sentences.chinese: 这艘小太空船，伽利略号片刻未停继续前往盖尼米德。

sentences.english: Galileo found that the two pendulums kept swinging together with the same rhythm.
sentences.chinese: 伽利略发现，两个摆锤一直以相同的节奏一起摆动。

sentences.english: This is the basis of the Galilean transformation, and the concept of frame of reference.
sentences.chinese: 这是根据伽利略变换的概念，并参考框架。

sentences.english: In 1623, a longtime friend of Galileo's became the Pope.
sentences.chinese: 年，伽利略的一位长期朋友成为教皇。

sentences.english: Four hundred years ago, Galileo was the first to observe similar phases of the planet Venus.
sentences.chinese: 四百年前，伽利略第一次观察到金星具有类似的相位。

sentences.english: Galileo called the old strutting Aristotelian conservatives, The Pigeon League.
sentences.chinese: 伽利略称趾高气扬的亚斯多德派保守份子为鸽盟。

definition: Mikolaj Kopernik or Nicolaus Copernicus (1473-1543), Polish astronomer, mathematician and polymath
Newton (name)/Sir Isaac Newton (1642-1727), British mathematician and physicist
heliocentric theory/the theory that the sun is at the center of the universe
Huygens (name)/Christiaan Huygens (1629-1695), Dutch mathematician and astronomer
Johannes Kepler (1571-1630), German astronomer and formulator of Kepler's laws of planetary motion

pinyin: Jia1 li4 lu:e4 · Jia1 li4 lei2

definition: Sir Isaac Newton (1642-1727), British mathematician and physicist
Leibnitz (name)/Gottfriend Wilhelm von Leibniz (1646-1716), German mathematician and philosopher, co-inventor of the calculus
Euclid of Alexandria (c. 300 BC), Greek geometer and author of Elements 幾何原本|几何原本
